DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Testing Sensitivity or Contraindication Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not sensitivity or contraindication for testing is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Test Sensitivity Or Medical Contraindication Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Property.preferredDefinition: The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Dr. Turkbey P173316 request 11.21.17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves
